CatDescriptText: Mr. Otis Johnikines, laborer, 129 N. Lang Ave. was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1959, pg. 1 with question: "Do you think that education standards should be the same throughout the city school system or should they be lowered in order to accommodate the slower-learning pupils, particularly those who suffer the handicaps of poor home or neighborhood environments?" answer reads: "No, there should be no lowering of the school standards, because we have trade schools for those children who are slow learners."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Otis Johnikines wearing dark zippered jacket and dark hat, posed in front of textured wall
